item.ptxt: Confirm the sheet thickness, tensile strength, and existence of the zinc treatment of both sides, and set the welder to conform to the welding conditions by referring to Front Body Construction, Roof and Side Panel Construction, and Floor and Rear Body Construction.
Welding symbols (The welding symbols with dashed lines have a meaning of the spot welding of the part which is not visible)

s1.ptxt: Install the new front pillar inner separator (A) on the side sill stiffener (B).Apply the sealer (C) without gaps all the way around the separator.
Set the new front pillar lower stiffener complete, and tack weld it into position.
Rough-cut the front side outer panel repair part, clamp it to the body, and check the dimensions:
Remove the outer panel repair part.
Weld the front pillar lower stiffener complete (A) to the side sill stiffener (B) and the upper stiffener (C).
()*: Welding positions with the front pillar upper stiffener and the side sill stiffener, high-strength steel ( MPa) parts. Confirm the MIG brazing conditions.

Install the new front pillar outer separator (A) on the front pillar lower stiffener complete (B).Apply the sealer (C) without gaps all the way around the separator and inside the outer panel repair part (D).
Clamp the outer panel repair part, and recheck the clearance and alignment of the door(s), the front fender, and the windshield.
Do the main welding. Weld the outer panel repair part (A) and the front pillar lower stiffener (B).

()*: Welding positions with the front pillar upper stiffener (C) and the side sill stiffener (D), high-strength steel ( MPa) parts. Perform the spot welding on the conditions of No. and No. in the table shown below. Confirm the MIG brazing conditions.
( )*: Welding positions with MPa or higher parts. Confirm the plug welding conditions.

figure.title: Door opening and side sill areas
